title: Authorizes the commissioner of health to conduct a study relating to airline noise at and around John F. Kennedy International Airport
summary: Authorizes the commissioner of health to conduct a study relating to airline noise at and around John F. Kennedy International Airport, with particular emphasis on noise caused by the SST-Concorde and similar aircraft.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation  to  authorizing  the
         commissioner  of  health to conduct a study concerning noise caused by
         airline traffic at John F. Kennedy International Airport

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 206 of the public health law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 28 to read as follows:
    3    28.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  AUTHORIZE A STUDY TO BE MADE CONCERNING
    4  NOISE CAUSED BY AIRLINE TRAFFIC AT AND AROUND JOHN F.  KENNEDY  INTERNA-
    5  TIONAL AIRPORT. SUCH STUDY SHALL PARTICULARLY INCLUDE AN EMPHASIS ON THE
    6  NOISE  MADE  BY  THE  SST-CONCORDE AND OTHER SIMILAR AIRCRAFT. THE STUDY
    7  SHALL ALSO INCLUDE AND DETAIL THE FOLLOWING:
    8    (A) THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF ARRIVALS AND DEPARTURES AT SUCH AIRPORT ON A
    9  DAILY BASIS;
   10    (B) THE AVERAGE DECIBEL LEVEL OF ARRIVING AND DEPARTING AIRCRAFT;
   11    (C) WHETHER THE NOISE CREATED BY SUCH AIRLINE TRAFFIC  CAUSES  HEARING
   12  OR OTHER HEALTH PROBLEMS FOR RESIDENTS RESIDING NEAR SUCH AIRPORT; AND
   13    (D) ANY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR REDUCING THE NOISE OUTPUT AT SUCH AIRPORT.
   14  SUCH  STUDY  SHALL  BE SUBMITTED TO THE GOVERNOR AND THE CHAIRPERSONS OF
   15  THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY HEALTH COMMITTEES WITHIN ONE YEAR OF THE  EFFEC-
   16  TIVE DATE OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   17    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2069

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public health law, in relation to authorizing the
commissioner of health to conduct a study concerning noise caused by
airline traffic at John F. Kennedy International Airport

PURPOSE:
The purpose of this legislation is to
authorize a study to be
made relative to the noise caused by airline traffic at John F.
Kennedy International Airport, specifically to determine whether the
noise currently generated by airline traffic exceeds the "acceptable
noise levels" that are currently established by the Federal Aviation
Authority, Federal Department of Transportation, Environmental
Protection Agency, and other appropriate agency/agencies.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill authorizes a study to be made concerning the noise
at John F. Kennedy International Airport
to determine if the noise created by such airline traffic,
particularly from SST Concord and similar airlines, causes hearing
loss or other health problems for residents in surrounding
communities. The legislation also provides for recommendations to be
made for reducing noise at John F. Kennedy International Airport.

JUSTIFICATION:
The noise created by airline traffic,
particularly, the
SST Concord, is so loud that the effects of such regular and loud
noise should be studied. Reports of persons believing their home was
about to be struck by a falling aircraft are sadly not uncommon.
House alarms are regularly setoff upon ascent of the SST Concord.
Children cover their ears, some cry in fear, and unsuspecting adults
are often shocked by the loud vibrating reverberations of these
airlines.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
